news.title: Over 50,000 houses in Goa will be regularised over next few days
news.para: Goa is set to regularise over 50,000 houses following the passage of three key bills in the recent legislative assembly session. The 'Majhe Ghar' initiative aims to grant land rights to long-term residents, including those on government and comunidade land, with certain conditions and restrictions.

news.title: Divide Dharavi land equally for rehabilitation units & for-sale buildings: Maharashtra CM
news.para: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has instructed the Dharavi Redevelopment Project to increase tenement sizes for ineligible residents and those in planned buildings. Land in Dharavi will be equally divided between rehabilitation and for-sale components. A digital model mirroring Dharavi's survey will be adopted for all Mumbai slums.

news.title: DDA looks to finish transit-oriented project at Karkardooma by December 2026
news.para: The Delhi Development Authority's Karkardooma transit-oriented development project, featuring approximately 500 EWS units and 1,000 middle-income group flats, is slated for completion by December 2026. Construction progresses with structural work nearing completion, while booking for all flats may commence together once services are operational.

news.title: Noida authority to cancel allotments of plots still encroached
news.para: Noida Authority is cracking down on property encroachments, warning residents to remove unauthorized constructions like balcony extensions and extra rooms or face plot cancellations. CEO Lokesh M has ordered strict monitoring and direct notice delivery to ensure compliance. The authority is also addressing road construction delays due to land occupation and resolving cleanliness and waterlogging issues across the city.

news.title: Bengaluru: Mandatory for builders to submit CCs before transferring flats to buyers
news.para: This move comes as a response to the ongoing issue of illegal constructions that have been circumventing official approvals and permissions. These constructions have led to significant financial losses for the city corporation.​

news.title: VMRDA to develop four theme-based townships in Visakhapatnam
news.para: The VMRDA is seeking a transaction advisor to develop four theme-based townships across 500 acres in Visakhapatnam, focusing on sectors like IT, health, and tourism. These integrated urban clusters aim to promote a walk-to-work culture and sustainable urban innovation. The project, aligning with NITI Aayog's vision, anticipates significant job creation and economic development through public-private partnerships.

news.title: West Bengal REAT orders developer to buy back CC-less flat after two decades
news.para: The West Bengal Real Estate Appellate Tribunal (WBREAT) has directed a developer, Satchidananda Mitra of Sona Enterprise, to buy back a flat sold two decades ago due to the lack of a completion certificate. The buyer, Sibsankar Koley, was unable to complete the mutation after living there for 19 years.

news.title: Central Park taps advisors for planned 2027 real estate IPO
news.para: Central Park plans to list its real estate business by early 2027 and its hospitality vertical in 3–4 years. With a Rs 11,000-crore launch pipeline, major projects in Gurugram, and land acquisitions in Rajasthan and Goa, the developer is targeting growth. FY25 pre-sales surged to Rs 1,600 crore from Rs 250 crore in FY24.

news.title: Co-operative society valid under RERA can manage apartment projects: Karnataka HC
news.para: However, the High Court saw through the deception and identified that an illegal association created to maintain the project and conduct unauthorised transactions was at the centre of it. This association had already been stopped by the Registrar of Societies.

news.title: Hinjewadi road clean-up spurs demand in Pune for stricter construction site transport rules
news.para: Following complaints from Hinjewadi residents, MIDC has arranged for cleaning of mud and debris deposited on roads by construction vehicles near Megapolis Township. They've instructed site managers to cover vehicles and wash wheels, though residents demand stricter enforcement and continuous action to prevent accidents caused by slippery roads.

news.title: PM inaugurates yellow line of Bengaluru metro rail
news.para: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Bangalore Metro's Yellow Line, a 19-km stretch from RV Road to Bommasandra, aimed at easing traffic in congested IT corridors. The project, costing ₹7,160 crore, includes 16 stations and will expand Bengaluru's metro network to over 96 km.

news.title: Puravankara posts net loss of ₹68.55 crore Q1 FY26
news.para: Puravankara reported a net consolidated loss of ₹68.55 crore in Q1 FY26, a stark contrast to the previous year's profit. Despite a sales increase of six percent, regulatory changes impacted handovers and sales expectations. The company is expanding its growth pipeline through strategic land acquisitions and redevelopment projects, while also making key leadership appointments and re-appointments.

news.title: Guwahati: Over 205 evicted, 146 houses razed across 300 bighas in Doyang Reserve Forest
news.para: In Golaghat district, the forest department initiated an eviction drive in Doyang Reserve Forest, demolishing 146 illegally occupied houses. This action followed a July 24 notice, prompting legal challenges and a Gauhati High Court order. While 59 houses were spared due to an August 5 court directive, the operation aimed to reclaim over 300 bighas of encroached forest land.

news.title: Mysuru development body sanctions new layouts, approves projects, digitization plans
news.para: The Mysuru Development Authority (MDA) has approved the auctioning of sites and sanctioned land for war martyrs. They are also planning to develop mobile applications for property management and record digitization. Furthermore, MDA approved new layout projects spanning 400 acres and addressed the provision of sale deeds to house allottees.

news.title: Mohali development body to hold draw for Aerocity’s SCOs, bay shops on Aug 14
news.para: Gmada will conduct a numbering draw on August 14 for commercial SCOs and bay shops in Aerocity allotted under the land pooling scheme. The draw is for eligible Letter of Intent holders, with the list available on the Gmada website.

news.title: Coimbatore district collector issues show-cause notices to 40 revenue officials over illegal sand mining
news.para: Coimbatore district collector issued show-cause notices to 40 revenue officials, both former and present, for allegedly failing to prevent illegal sand mining in Perur taluk from 2019 to 2025. This action follows a Madras High Court directive and a panel report confirming illegal excavation. A CB-CID team is currently investigating the illegal mining activities in the district.

news.title: Indore: New housing, infrastructure projects to facilitate MR-10 development
news.para: "IDA board on Friday decided to construct housing units under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana Urban 2.0 on a 1.613-hectare plot (FP-422) within the IDA's Town Planning Scheme (TPS)-08," IDA CEO RP Ahirwar said.

news.title: Nashik civic body exempts telecom companies from paying realty tax for towers
news.para: The Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) has exempted telecom companies from property tax on mobile towers starting January 2025, following state government guidelines aligning with the Telecommunication Act, 2023. While future taxes are waived, telcos must clear outstanding dues until December 2024. The NMC plans to lease spaces for tower installations to generate revenue.
